title: Sanctuary counties: Inside America's gun rights resistance
description: Democrats swept to victory in Virginia after campaigning on stricter gun control. Weeks later, the backlash began.

title: I need to knock out Wilder to be certain of win, says Fury
description: Tyson Fury says he will have to knock out Deontay Wilder in their rematch to avoid a repeat of the judging controversy of their first fight.

title: Jamaica deportation: 'I feel I was punished twice when I was deported'
description: Rayan Crawford, who lived in the UK for 22 years, says he was crying in pain on the plane to Jamaica.

title: No talks on new deal, says Wolves boss Nuno
description: Nuno Espirito Santo says Wolverhampton Wanderers "is my life" but reveals he has had no talks about a new contract.

title: Premier League Darts: Fallon Sherrock draws with Glen Durrant on Premier League debut
description: Fallon Sherrock narrowly misses out on another stunning victory, drawing with Glen Durrant on her Premier League debut.

title: Quick-thinking customer knocks shoplifter off his feet
description: A man in Georgia helped police stop a fleeing Walmart shoplifter.

title: MP Tracy Brabin's off-the-shoulder dress sells for £20k
description: Labour MP Tracy Brabin auctioned off the dress for charity after it caused controversy in the Commons.

title: Dominic Cummings: Who is Boris Johnson's senior adviser?
description: The controversial former Vote Leave campaign director is one of the PM's most senior advisers.

title: Are coronavirus tests flawed?
description: Concerns are being raised about the accuracy of the tests for the coronavirus.

title: Stormzy scraps Asian tour over coronavirus
description: The rap star postpones gigs "due to the ongoing health and travel concerns" surrounding the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Sharp increase in deaths and cases in Hubei
description: Two top officials are sacked after the spike was revealed, resulting from a new diagnostic method.

title: East Kent baby deaths: Independent review into NHS trust
description: A local MP says women are now "terrified" about giving birth at the two Kent hospitals.

title: Cabinet reshuffle: Sajid Javid resigns as chancellor
description: Rishi Sunak takes over as chancellor four weeks before the Budget as PM carries out a reshuffle.

title: Folau named in Catalans squad for first time
description: Israel Folau is named in Catalans Dragons' squad for the first time and could make his Super League debut against Castleford.

title: Lyra McKee murder: Paul McIntyre supporters clash with police
description: Lyra McKee, 29, died after she was shot in April 2019 while observing a riot in Londonderry's Creggan estate.

title: Labour calls for clarity over claims businessman paid for PM's £15,000 holiday
description: A Tory donor provided holiday accommodation to the PM, according to the register of MPs' interests.

title: Fly-tipping: Organised crime behind large rise
description: Gangs are setting up fake waste companies and dumping lorry loads of rubbish on private land.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'wooden'
description: Each week, we publish a gallery of readers' pictures on a set theme. This week it is "wooden".

title: Coronavirus: Hunt for contacts of latest UK case
description: England's chief medical officer says experts are focused on limiting the impact of any outbreak.

title: Bill Turnbull to sit in for Piers Morgan on Good Morning Britain
description: Turnbull will reunite with is former BBC Breakfast co-host Susanna Reid on Good Morning Britain.

title: Education ministers pull plug on 5,000 post-GCSE qualifications
description: Many courses with few or no students will be scrapped as ministers prepare for T-levels in England.

title: Natalie Portman responds to Rose McGowan's Oscars dress criticism
description: The actress was criticised for not "walking the walk" when it comes to supporting female directors.

title: Barclays boss Jes Staley 'deeply regrets' sex offender link
description: Financial watchdogs are investigating Jes Staley's links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Sonic the Hedgehog movie: Critics put the brakes on
description: The Sega game character is now a new-and-improved film star, but still not good enough for some.

title: Ighalo kept away from Man Utd training ground over coronavirus fears
description: Odion Ighalo is kept away from Manchester United's training ground as a precautionary measure to guard against the potential risk posed by coronavirus.

title: 'We don't buy superstars, we make them' - how Dortmund develop young talent
description: Borussia Dortmund's head of youth, Lars Ricken, gives insight into how the Bundesliga side identify future stars.

title: Rapper confronts audience member at NME Awards
description: The rapper was heckled during a speech and jumped into the crowd after a drink was thrown at him.

title: Cannabis oil products ‘could be off the shelves in a year’
description: Unapproved goods containing the cannabis extract will be pulled, says the Food Standards Agency.

title: 'If all freelancers walked out, the TV industry would stop'
description: As an industry mental health taskforce is launched, a producer speaks out about the lack of support.

title: Britain's race to contain the coronavirus
description: Health officials are trying to contain the virus after a cluster of cases on the south coast. Can the virus be kept at bay?

title: Coronavirus: The Valentine messages to medics in Singapore
description: People in Singapore are posting messages of thanks to healthcare professionals treating coronavirus.

title: Why harbour master Georgina Carlo-Paat spent her life at sea
description: Georgina Carlo-Paat, one of the UK's first female harbour masters, describes her 30-year career at sea.

title: Photo exhibition showcases the people tackling poverty
description: The Our People, Our Poverty exhibition showcases the volunteers helping their struggling neighbours.

title: Winchester friends set up wheelchair dance class
description: When Vickie started using a wheelchair, she returned to a studio and found a passion for dance.

title: The South African volunteers fixing their town
description: In South Africa, residents sick of intermittent water and power in their town are taking action.

title: Dresden: The World War Two bombing 75 years on
description: A firestorm caused by Allied bombers destroyed the historic centre of Dresden in February 1945.

title: Afghan sports coach says she will flee after dog shot dead
description: Sahba Barakzai, who teaches sport to young girls in Afghanistan, was attacked while walking the dog.

title: 'I could have been a K-pop idol - but I'm glad I quit'

title: Coronavirus: Will someone develop a vaccine?
description: Global pharmaceutical companies may not see enough profitability from developing a Covid-19 vaccine.
